decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells and removal while leveraging powerful artifacts like Time Vault and Lurrus of the Dream-Den. The deck aims to control the board by using cards like Fatal Push and Force of Will, while also generating card advantage and manipulating the graveyard with cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. Additionally, the deck has access to powerful mana acceleration with cards like Black Lotus and Sol Ring, allowing for early game plays and setting up powerful late-game combos.

The main strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and dismantle the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage and control over the board. The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Spell Pierce to counter opponent's spells, while also leveraging efficient removal like Fatal Push and Orcish Bowmasters to deal with threats. The deck also includes card filtering and card advantage engines like Brainstorm, Ancestral Recall, and Dig Through Time to maintain consistency and card advantage throughout the game.

This deck focuses on maximizing resource denial and disruption to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays from artifact creatures and mana denial effects. The deck aims to control the game with cards like Sphere of Resistance, Null Rod, and Trinisphere while also utilizing Mishra's Workshop and Urza's Saga to generate mana and create threats. By utilizing powerful artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim, the deck aims to quickly close out the game by overwhelming the opponent with efficient threats and disruptive elements.

This Vintage Combo deck revolves around using powerful artifact mana sources, such as Mishra's Workshop and Grim Monolith, to generate a large amount of mana quickly. The goal is to assemble the infinite mana combo with Mana Vault, Mana Crypt, and Manifold Key to power out game-winning spells like Tinker for The One Ring or Paradoxical Outcome to draw into more resources. The deck includes control elements like Force of Will and Trinisphere to protect the combo pieces, while also utilizing cards like Mystic Forge and Urza's Saga for extra utility and card advantage.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage. It utilizes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Black Lotus, and other restricted Vintage staples to control the board and out-value opponents. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland, Force of Will, and Force of Negation to prevent opponents from executing their strategies. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a valuable companion, providing additional recursion and value throughout the game. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and grind out advantages to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board while applying pressure on the opponent. It includes powerful cards like Force of Will, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to disrupt the opponent's game plan while creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Tarmogoyf provide a steady stream of damage. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck revolves around utilizing artifacts and card draw to create a powerful combo with Paradoxical Outcome, allowing the player to generate massive amounts of mana and card advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to recast low-cost artifacts from the graveyard. The key strategy is to efficiently cycle through the deck, generate mana, and ultimately win through a powerful combo turn.

This Aggro deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard with cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to quickly bring back creatures like Vengevine and Squee, Goblin Nabob. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap to control the game, while also utilizing cards like Noxious Revival and Hollow One for additional value and pressure. By combining graveyard synergy with disruptive elements, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful offense.

The key concept of this Vintage Combo-Dredge deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with dredge cards like Golgari Thug and Stinkweed Imp, then abuse cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to bring back powerful creatures like Ichorid and Narcomoeba for free. This allows the deck to generate a lot of value and overwhelm opponents with a swarm of creatures, taking advantage of graveyard synergies with cards like Prized Amalgam and Bridge from Below. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Cabal Therapy to protect its combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Time Vault and mana rocks combo to take infinite turns and win the game. It utilizes cards like Paradoxical Outcome to draw into the necessary pieces and protect the combo with counter magic. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion for extra recursion and value. The deck is fast-paced and aims to win as quickly as possible before the opponent has a chance to disrupt the combo. The key strategy is to efficiently and effectively assemble the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan.
